newsitem.title: USA: Carolina Power Brunswick nuke cuts power.
newsitem.headline: Carolina Power Brunswick nuke cuts power.

text.p: Carolina Power & Light Co's 754 megawatt Brunswick nuclear power unit 2 in Southport, N.C., has reduced power to about 62 percent of capacity for repairs, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said Monday.
The unit reduced power over the weekend to repair a reactor feed pump, the NRC said in its daily plant status report.
Company officials were not immediately available for comment, and it was not known how long the unit would operate at the reduced level or if it would be shut completely.

Carolina Power's 767 megawatt Brunswick nuclear power unit 1 at the same Southport site, was reducing power ahead of a scheduled maintenance and refueling shutdown set to begin October 5 and last for 35 days.
The Brunswick 1 unit was operating at 91 percent of capacity as of early Monday morning, the NRC said.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
